page.title: 08FLUORSPAR MINING WARDLOW
page.content: {INDUSTRY WARDLOW CRESSBROOK} {Quarrying.}By volcanic action 250 million years ago in this area of Derbyshire veins of{FLUORSPAR,BARYTES {and CALCITES}were formed.These important commercial minerals are extracted by quarrying techniques and transported for processing. {FLUORSPAR}is used as a flux in the making of steel.It is a basic chemical used in the lining of non-stick pans,fluoride toothpaste,and fluorisation of water. {CALCITE}is used in the making of aluminium for producing hydrofluoric acid.When ground up it is used as a filler in the making of paint for roads, and for pebble dashing. {BARYTES}is used in the paint making industry.The work force consists of 3 local men,working 9 hrs,5days a week at Â£3 an hour.
